paragraphs.text: Ditch the to-do list and use your calendar as your number one productivity tool. Take some time to plan your week. Ask: When will I do what? Then, schedule it in your calendar. I do this exercise every day.
paragraphs.name: e960

paragraphs.text: 23% of Americans have not read a single book in the past year. And the number of books people read per year are also not pretty. Only 28% reads more than 11 books per year.
1. Grammarly

This is very true. using my calendar to make sure I do what I really have to do on any given day is very effective. It helps me a lot cutting down on procrastination time. I still use a to-do list though, Wunderlist actually, to help me keeping track of various loose ends I need to tie in a reasonable timeframe. Overall, it works for me.
